Kernel type.

Number of datasamples.
Matrix (vector of vectors) of 1D kernel pointers that define full kernel density distribution.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< Eigen::VectorXd > &samples, const double bandWidthFactor=1.0, const KernelType kernel_type=KernelType::gaussian_kernel, const Eigen::VectorXd &manualStandardDeviation=Eigen::VectorXd::Zero(0), const Eigen::VectorXd &manualBandwidth=Eigen::VectorXd::Zero(0))
memberdef.name: KernelDensityDistribution

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para:
Constructor
samples
Data samples from which the empirical distribution is to be created.
bandWidthFactor
Factor by which to multiply the computed bandwidth values of the kernels.
kernel_type
Type of distribution to be used for the kernels in the distribution.
manualStandardDeviation
Standard deviations with which to scale the entries of each sample. By default this vector is empty and not used. If it is provided, it is used to scale the entry i of each sample by manualStandardDeviation( i ) / sampleStandardDeviation( i ), where sampleStandardDeviation is the standard deviation computed from the samples/
manualBandwidth
Vector of bandwidths for each dimension that is to be used in the kernels. By default this vector is empty and not used. Optimal bandwidths (scaled by bandWidthFactor) are used in this default case.

briefdescription.para: Function to evaluate cumulative probability of marginal distribution of conditional distribution at single dimension.

List of dimensions in which cdf is given
conditions
Independent variables at which values of cdf, in dimensions listed in conditionDimensions, are to be computed.
marginalDimension
Dimension in which the marginal cdf is to be computed
independentVariable
Independent variable at which conditional marginal cdf is to be computed
Cumulative conditional probability of marginal distribution at given settings.

briefdescription.para: Function that generates the kernel density distribution based on the samples and kernel type that is provided.

detaileddescription.para: Function that generates the kernel density distribution based on the samples and kernel type that is provided. This function iteratively calls the constructKernel function to create a kernel for each entry in each sample.

briefdescription.para: Class that uses random samples to generate a multivariate probability distribution using Kernel Density distribution.

detaileddescription.para: Class that uses random samples to generate a multivariate probability distribution using Kernel Density distribution. The bandwidth of the kernels may be supplied by the user, or an optimal distrubution may be computed by this class At present, the user has the choice of a Gaussian or Epanechnikov distribution for the kernels.
